I really wish you people lived in Korea where half the time, if a movie has any foreign language, it's translated directly to Korean.  The other half of the time, there is and over under english/korean deal going on.  Korean subs are a way of life here and NOTHING to complain about when you're getting a movie for free.  Shit, I PAY to go see a movie, knowing full well, that there will be hard coded Korean Subs... that movie is also in 4-D with moving seats and spritzes in the face.  XD

Thanks for the upload hero!

I do however have a suggestion:
Separate the subs from the movie as in putting the subs in a separate file so you can turn them on as an option instead of having them forced down our throats :)

In any case, A:10 V:10 excellent upload!

Man if the subs weren't such a bitch I would have seeded to 2.5 I only seeded 1.5

((((How To get rid of hardcoded subtitles.)))

Step 1. Get a Program called "MOVAVI VIDEO CONVERTER 11"
In PRESET chose "MKV for DVD quality video (*.mkv)" 
(MKV are also known as "Matroska Video File")
(This will rid the file of Hardcoded subs)

Step 2. Use "AVS VIDEO CONVERTER" to convert the "MKV File" back to an "AVI File".

If A MKV File is subcoded use "VSO.Convert.X.to.DVD.3"(Or a Current Version)
click on Setting, chose subtitles then click on "Text subtitles rendering settings"
in the :Colors - Contrast: set all 4 to 0 "use the mouse set them to 0" then click on "OK"
this will convert the File to VOB's (DVD FILES)
To convert the VOB back to an AVI File use "AVS VIDEO CONVERTER" 
"Only chose one VOB File to convert" that VOB should be called "VTS_01_0"
